pageContent: Objective: To compare the pain of injection and biopsy when lidocaine is injected periprostatically either at a basal or apical site, as the former is commonly used to anaesthetise the prostate, based on several reports showing that it can eliminate most of the pain associated with prostate biopsy, and this site has been favoured over apical injection because the nerves enter the prostate from the basal aspect.

metaData.source:
Variability of transrectal ultrasound-guided prostate biopsy prophylactic measures
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23228295/
